MELANIE 
Or at least find someone else to fuss over. 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
12 
 
BASIRA 
Yeah, he’s got it bad. 
 
Do you know if he and John ever… 
 
MELANIE 
No clue, and not interested. Although according to Georgie, John doesn’t. Like, 
at all. 
 
BASIRA 
Oh. Yeah, that does explain some stuff. Wait, hang on, do I know Georgie? 
 
MELANIE 
I don’t think so. Georgie Barker? She does What the Ghost? 
 
BASIRA 
No way, I used to love that show! I mean, the first couple of seasons, at least. 
Took a weird turn in Season 3, when they introduced— 
 
MELANIE 
Well, she and John, they dated. 
 
BASIRA 
Yeah? 
 
MELANIE 
I mean, it was years ago, but— 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
13 
 
 
BASIRA 
Huh. I always used to put on podcasts when I was driving around. You know, 
when I wasn’t on duty, and when Daisy didn’t need the radio. 
 
MELANIE 
I literally cannot picture Daisy listening to the radio. 
 
BASIRA 
The Archers. 
 
MELANIE 
No. 
 
BASIRA 
Hand to God. 
 
MELANIE 
I, I actually do not believe you. 
 
BASIRA 
She never missed an episode. 
 
(Melanie exhales in astonishment) 
 
Oh, sorry, did you need to finish up? 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
14 
 
MELANIE 
No, I, I actually have no idea what I was going to say. I did have more notes on, 
um, on... space, I guess? But uh, forget it, let’s go. 
 
BASIRA 
I should probably go check in with Martin, you know, see if he’s in for drinks. 
 
MELANIE 
So you can double-check your gossip? 
 
BASIRA 
I don’t gossip. I have the mind of an investigator. 
 
MELANIE 
Right, okay. Anyway, I’ll go find him. 
 
(Melanie gets up) 
 
I could really do with the walk. Do you want to go ahead, grab the booth? 
 
BASIRA 
Yeah, sure, I can wait. I’ve got a book. 
 
MELANIE 
Of course you do. 
 
(Click) 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
15 
 
 
(Click) 
 
(Papers are shuffled, followed by a door knock) 
 
ELIAS 
Come in, Melanie. 
 
(Door opens) 
 
MELANIE 
(Guardedly) Martin said you wanted to see me? 
 
ELIAS 
Yes, please come in. I thought it was about time for your first performance 
review. 
 
MELANIE 
(Laughing) I, um, I didn’t even know that was, uh... Well, there wasn’t anything 
scheduled. 
 
ELIAS 
No, well, given the recent, um, tensions in the office, I thought it probably best 
if you weren’t aware of it in advance. 
 
MELANIE 
Right... 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
16 
 
 
ELIAS 
Less time to prepare, you understand. 
 
MELANIE 
Right. 
 
ELIAS 
So, have a seat. 
 
You’ve been with us a few months now, I believe. 
 
MELANIE 
Yeah. 
 
ELIAS 
And how are you finding it? 
 
MELANIE 
Is that a joke? 
 
ELIAS 
Aside from the obvious, I mean. 
 
MELANIE 
Oh, well, I suppose it’s been... unstructured. Without John around and with 
you being sat up here lurking, there’s not been a lot of useful direction. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
17 
 
 
ELIAS 
(Making notes) I see. 
 
MELANIE 
I mean, you pick out a statement occasionally, and John might phone in to ask 
after some scrap of information, but to be honest, no-one’s even really told me 
what an “archival assistant” is actually supposed to do. 
 
ELIAS 
So how have you been occupying your time? 
 
MELANIE 
Reading, mostly. Doing some of my own research. 
 
ELIAS 
Into what? 
 
MELANIE 
(Defensive) My own projects. 
 
ELIAS 
Of course. And ‘plotting my demise’? 
 
MELANIE 
When I get a chance, yes. 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG106 ‘A Matter of Perspective’ 
 
18 
 
ELIAS 
Hm. 
 
MELANIE 
I suppose that doesn’t look very good on my review? 
 
ELIAS 
Quite frankly, no. 
 
MELANIE 
Well, if you need to fire me, I won’t make a scene. 
 
ELIAS 
No, no, I’m afraid not. 
 
MELANIE 
Sure. 
 
ELIAS 
(Sighing) I wish I knew the words that would make you believe me. 
 
MELANIE 
What? That you’re a literal dead man’s switch. 
 
ELIAS 
No. If that was the only issue, I could have simply placed the knowledge in your 
mind.
